title: Base Function
text: Since intervals are based on x-values, we only have to pay attention to horizontal shifts and reflections. There are no reflections, so we only have to look at the horizontal shifts. The base function of f(x) is $$x^2$$. In $$x^2$$ functions, the graph decreases for every x-value before the vertex, and increases for every x-value after the vertex.

title: Base Function
text: This means that if we find the the x-value of the vertex, we can find where the function increases and decreases.

title: Vertex
text: We have to find the x-value of the vertex of the transformations. The function is horizontally shifted three x-value to the left.

title: Vertex
text: What is the x-value of the vertex?

title: Intervals
text: So, since the vertex is at $$x=-3$$, and $$x^2$$ increases after the vertex and decreases after the vertex, we know what intervals the function increases and decreases on.
